content: It is clear now more than ever that what we believe America to be is just not true. There is no freedom when our financial system enslaves the masses, there is no independence when government insists on doing everything for us, there is no freedom of speech when the mainstream media overtly takes sides. The election of President Obama was historic, i'm sure he's a great man, he's in great shape, he's phenomenal, he is "The Game"...but its time to get past that and see that he is just another symbol of the status quo. I'm sick of watching the Media take sides. Its not just that rag MSNBC, its also Fox News, the New York Times/Post, CNN...etc They are all under the control of just 5 corporate entities, what does that tell you??? I was in a very combat oriented unit, and one of me dear friends became a tree hugging liberal ******, but I still love em. Either way, even he can see the BS going on with this administration...

I'm getting pretty tired of the national cheerleader going abroad and breathlessly apologize for so-called transgressions and arrogance. It really is true, liberals just don't see the enemies of America for what they are: Tireless, determined, and anxious to do us harm....From South America, to Europe, to Asia and the Middle East... Now? I feel we have to include some of our people in that mix.

content: The price of our democratic republic is that bad laws and policies sometimes get enacted. Witness the Fugitive Slave Act, Prohibition, and the policy of 'Separate but Equal'. The saving virtue of our system is that any such law can be overturned, however long and painful that process might be - 13th and 14th Amendments, Brown vs. the Board of Education, etc. Some people here decry change and wish for 'the good ol' days' without realizing that those days are gone and our current days are what we make of them. Some people decry our government, as if they had no say in the matter and lack the means and wherewithal of contacting their representatives directly to speak their mind. Don't cry about your congressional representatives' actions and voting record if you've never contacted them to tell them how you wish them to vote. You have that ability and opportunity. It's not, 'you get what you pay for', it is 'you get what you tolerate'. That's your lot as a citizen. Want change? Make it. Sullivan013
reply: The price of our democratic republic is that bad laws and policies sometimes get enacted. Witness the Fugitive Slave Act, Prohibition, and the policy of 'Separate but Equal'. The saving virtue of our system is that any such law can be overturned, however long and painful that process might be - 13th and 14th Amendments, Brown vs. the Board of Education, etc. Some people here decry change and wish for 'the good ol' days' without realizing that those days are gone and our current days are what we make of them. Some people decry our government, as if they had no say in the matter and lack the means and wherewithal of contacting their representatives directly to speak their mind. Don't cry about your congressional representatives' actions and voting record if you've never contacted them to tell them how you wish them to vote. You have that ability and opportunity. It's not, 'you get what you pay for', it is 'you get what you tolerate'. That's your lot as a citizen. Want change? Make it. Sullivan013

content: It is clear now more than ever that what we believe America to be is just not true. There is no freedom when our financial system enslaves the masses, there is no independence when government insists on doing everything for us, there is no freedom of speech when the mainstream media overtly takes sides. The election of President Obama was historic, i'm sure he's a great man, he's in great shape, he's phenomenal, he is "The Game"...but its time to get past that and see that he is just another symbol of the status quo. I'm sick of watching the Media take sides. Its not just that rag MSNBC, its also Fox News, the New York Times/Post, CNN...etc They are all under the control of just 5 corporate entities, what does that tell you??? I was in a very combat oriented unit, and one of me dear friends became a tree hugging liberal ******, but I still love em. Either way, even he can see the BS going on with this administration...

The election of President Obama was historic, i'm sure he's a great man, he's in great shape, he's phenomenal, he is "The Game"...but its time to get past that and see that he is just another symbol of the status quo. I'm sick of watching the Media take sides. Its not just that rag MSNBC, its also Fox News, the New York Times/Post, CNN...etc They are all under the control of just 5 corporate entities, what does that tell you??? content: The price of our democratic republic is that bad laws and policies sometimes get enacted. Witness the Fugitive Slave Act, Prohibition, and the policy of 'Separate but Equal'. The saving virtue of our system is that any such law can be overturned, however long and painful that process might be - 13th and 14th Amendments, Brown vs. the Board of Education, etc. Some people here decry change and wish for 'the good ol' days' without realizing that those days are gone and our current days are what we make of them. Some people decry our government, as if they had no say in the matter and lack the means and wherewithal of contacting their representatives directly to speak their mind. Don't cry about your congressional representatives' actions and voting record if you've never contacted them to tell them how you wish them to vote. You have that ability and opportunity. It's not, 'you get what you pay for', it is 'you get what you tolerate'. That's your lot as a citizen. Want change? Make it. Sullivan013
reply: The price of our democratic republic is that bad laws and policies sometimes get enacted. Witness the Fugitive Slave Act, Prohibition, and the policy of 'Separate but Equal'. The saving virtue of our system is that any such law can be overturned, however long and painful that process might be - 13th and 14th Amendments, Brown vs. the Board of Education, etc. Some people here decry change and wish for 'the good ol' days' without realizing that those days are gone and our current days are what we make of them. Some people decry our government, as if they had no say in the matter and lack the means and wherewithal of contacting their representatives directly to speak their mind. Don't cry about your congressional representatives' actions and voting record if you've never contacted them to tell them how you wish them to vote. You have that ability and opportunity. It's not, 'you get what you pay for', it is 'you get what you tolerate'. That's your lot as a citizen. Want change? Make it. Sullivan013
